docs.lead_paragraph: Too many people die of overdoses because the people with them are afraid to call for help.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author David Sheff underscores need for laws that grant immunity to people who call emergency services when someone is overdosing on drugs; notes main reason why people do not call emergency services in such situations is a fear of being arrested.
docs.snippet: Too many people die of overdoses because the people with them are afraid to call for help.

docs.lead_paragraph: Luis Octavio López Vega, a former adviser to a Mexican drug czar and a D.E.A. informant, has been in hiding as Mexican officials seek his arrest and American officials have cut ties with him.

headline.seo: U.S. and Mexico, Amid Drug War, Spurn an Informant
headline.main: A Drug War Informer in No Man’s Land
headline.print_headline: A Drug War Informer in No Man’s Land

docs.abstract: Luis Octavio Lopez Vega, former Mexican police chief who played a leading role in what is widely considered the biggest drug-trafficking case in Mexican history, has been in hiding in the United States for more than a decade as Mexico seeks his arrest and American officials have cut ties with him; episode pitted the Mexican military against the United States Drug Enforcement Administration, as Lopez worked closely with each group simultaneously.
docs.snippet: Luis Octavio López Vega, a former adviser to a Mexican drug czar and a D.E.A. informant, has been in hiding as Mexican officials seek his arrest and American officials have cut ties with him.

byline.contributor: Karla Zabludovsky contributed reporting, and Lisa Schwartz contributed research.
